It’s Aino here from Slush.” font_size=”3vw” font_line_height=”1″ font_size_tablet=”6vw” font_size_phone=”8vw” animation_offset=”70%”][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]My journey started back in 2014 when I first volunteered at Slush and got hooked by the extraordinary community and the spirit within it. In the end, I ended up volunteering for four years in a row. In 2020, I joined the team full-time, and today, I am the COO.

I think there are as many different kinds of roles as there are volunteers. I have found myself helping speakers find the right stage, hosting roundtables, and selecting 400 top-tier startups to showcase their products at the heart of the Slush venue. These experiences showed me the true value of Slush and the power that +1000 volunteers can have in creating real progress and shaping the entrepreneurial tomorrow just in two days.

I think that volunteering at Slush is an exceptional experience as Slush would not be anything without its volunteers. As a volunteer, you will get a front-row seat to the edge of technology, see first-hand as true progress is made, and become part of a close-knit community of Slushers. Apply now, you won’t regret it.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/tab][tab icon_family=”none” title=”AMIN” id=”1696490093911-4″ tab_id=”1696490093911-8″][vc_row_inner font_size_phone=”8vw”][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]I volunteered at Slush for the first time in 2019, as a Group Lead. The experience was amazing, and I decided to apply again in 2020, but this time as a Team Lead. Unfortunately, COVID-19 messed up the plans, but luckily a new opportunity opened in 2021. I was selected to lead the Event help team.

There were nearly 70 volunteers on my team, and we were practically a Slush ad-hoc team that supported all other teams and operations. Being a Team Lead taught me important things, such as how to organize and lead a big team effectively, and how to help develop your team’s skills so they can reach their full potential. It also taught me how to act in stressful situations, such as when a speaker loses their voice, and you are asked for help. #truestory

In addition to gaining important leadership skills, being a Team Lead offers much more. As a team lead, you are part of Slush’s core team, and you get to see up close how the world’s finest event is put together. You get to see and experience things you wouldn’t get anywhere else. You get to meet amazing people and build long-term friendships. And of course, you get to have a lot of fun![/vc_column_text][nectar_cta btn_style=”basic” heading_tag=”h4″ button_color=”accent-color” button_color_hover=”#fafafa” text_color=”#101010″ Henri here from Slush.” font_size=”3vw” font_line_height=”1″ font_size_tablet=”6vw” font_size_phone=”8vw”][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]Before joining Slush in 2021 as a Team Lead, I was unsure what I wanted to do. I knew that I wanted to dip my toes into the startup scene, but my part in it was still unclear to me. Slush seemed like the best place in all of Europe to figure that out. A promise of endless optimism, a group of curious and open-minded people with a strong desire to build something meaningful – that’s what I thought of Slush. I couldn’t have been more right.

As an Analyst Team Lead, I matched the investors coming to Slush with startups and other investors. Working with investors and startups taught me a lot about how the world of venture and startups works – I learned what I liked about it and what I didn’t. No matter the role you take volunteering at Slush, you’ll be guaranteed to meet exceptional people, build and experience world-class event, and learn from tomorrow’s future shapers. The world’s leading startup event is built by volunteers, led by volunteers.

The one thing in common among the volunteers is the endless optimism. It doesn’t matter what you do or where you are in life; if you can and want to think big, volunteering at Slush can be a life-changing experience. From my time volunteering at Slush I value the most the people I met, experiencing the culture of the Slush community, and the feeling of moving the needle for entrepreneurs. And of course, having fun – it’s a lot of things, but most importantly, it’s a lot of fun![/vc_column_text][nectar_cta btn_style=”basic” heading_tag=”h4″ button_color=”accent-color” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What is Slush about?”][vc_column_text]Slush is a student-driven, not-for-profit movement with the mission to create and help the next generation of groundbreaking entrepreneurs, originally founded to change attitudes toward entrepreneurship. The Slush 2023 event features two days full of stage programs, in addition to several side events, talks at networking sessions, roundtable discussions, and facilitated workshops. Our speaker line-up includes successful founders, top-notch investors, and other startup and tech influencers.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”When does Slush take place?”][vc_column_text]Slush 2023 will take place physically on Nov 30–Dec 1, 2023, at Helsinki Expo and Convention Center (Messukeskus).[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Where is Slush organized?”][vc_column_text]Slush is organized in the Helsinki Expo and Convention Center. Address: Messuaukio 1, 00520 Helsinki Helsinki Expo and Convention Center is located just a few kilometers from the Helsinki city center – you’ll be able to arrive at the venue within 15 minutes from all around the city.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What is the number of volunteers this year?”][vc_column_text]In 2023 the Slush Team will be recruiting 47 Team Leads, 194 Group Leads, and 1378 volunteers.

In total, this results in over 1,500 volunteers.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What are the different volunteer roles at Slush?”][vc_column_text]Team Leads are the link between core team members and volunteers. As a Team Lead, you work as part of the Slush Fall Team, consisting of our full-time team members and Team Leads. Following our value trust by default, you’ll be given autonomy and responsibilities that contribute towards making Slush 2023 the best Slush to date.

Group Leads are responsible for running the core operations during the event days. They are also recruiting and training the volunteers for various different tasks.

Volunteers will be the biggest helping hands during the event days. They will be responsible for helping and executing various different tasks, mostly during Slush week.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What is the process for recruiting volunteers?”][vc_column_text]Team Leads will be recruited during the Spring. The Team Lead recruitment process is done through group interviews, which our core team conducts.

Group Leads will be recruited during the Fall by the Team Leads.

Volunteers will be recruited by our Group Leads during the Fall.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Is there an age limit to volunteering?”][vc_column_text]Yes, we don’t recruit under 18 year olds to be volunteers at Slush.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][/toggles][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-2-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_direction_desktop=”default” column_element_spacing=”default” desktop_text_alignment=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_backdrop_filter=”none” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” column_position=”default” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” animation_type=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” column_padding_type=”default” gradient_type=”default”][toggles style=”minimal_small” accordion=”true” accordion_starting_functionality=”closed”][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”When will the 2023 volunteer application open?”][vc_column_text]The Slush Group Lead & Volunteer application opens on 7 Aug and closes on 10 Sep.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What are the workloads for different volunteer positions?”][vc_column_text]Team Lead position approximate workload during the Fall: 15-25h/week.

Group Lead position maximum workload during the Fall: 10h/week.

Volunteer position approximate workload during the event week: 20h (depending on which team and what kind of tasks they have). Adding to the workload during the event days there will be different kinds of Volunteer activities such as Volunteer Day, Talkoot, Volunteer’s Afterparty, and Venue Tour.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”Does Slush cover travel and accommodation costs?”][vc_column_text]Unfortunately, Slush can’t offer traveling and accommodation costs for volunteers. During previous years some Group Leads and local volunteers have kindly offered their places to international volunteers. Although we can’t guarantee accommodation like this, since we can’t oblige anyone to offer a place to stay.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How should I proceed if I need a visa traveling to Finland?”][vc_column_text]Slush can help the recruited volunteers with their visa applications by providing them with an invitation letter. Contact finance@slush.org for this matter. Read more about Finland’s visa policies on the website of the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Extra-Color-2″ heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What are the important dates for volunteers?”][vc_column_text]The Slush Fall contains tons of fun events. In order to get the most out of your volunteer experience these are the important dates that would require your physical presence in Helsinki.

In 2023 the important dates will be the following:

  • 11 Nov – Volunteer Day 10-15
  • 27 Nov–1 Dec – Slush week
  • 2 Dec – Volunteer Afterparty 21-02:30
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”What are the important dates for group leads?”][vc_column_text]This exciting position offers training sessions to prepare for the greater responsibilities, which means that Group Leads have a larger time commitment and additional attendance dates:

In 2023 the important dates will be the following:

  • 11 Oct – Leadership Experience #1 17-20
  • 14 Oct – Talkoot 2 9-18
  • 1 Nov – Leadership Experience #2 17-20
  • 11 Nov – Volunteer Day 10-15
  • 27 Nov–1 Dec – Slush week
  • 2 Dec – Volunteer Afterparty 21-02:30
[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” heading_tag=”h6″ heading_tag_functionality=”default” title=”How do I contact the Slush team?”][vc_column_text]You can reach the Slush People Team by
